Description: Foot, tondo and body fragment (mended from two sherds) of Attic black-glazed pottery cup (cup-skyphos?); moulded ring foot, reserved groove on outside wall above junction with foot; reserved underside, decorated with two circles and a dot; decoration inside: stamped double palmettes, linked and irregularly set, between two circles of tongues; inscription on the underside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

See also See C. C. Edgar, 'The Inscribed and Painted Pottery', Annual of the British School at Athens, vol. 5 (1898-1899), p. 56, no. 115. J.D. Beazley, "Some Inscriptions on Vases", American Journal of Archaeology 32 (1927) 352, fig. 3.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 705, no. 638)
Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (no. 115)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1311)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
